components.label: Has the site been used for any industrial or commercial uses described in SCHEDULE 2 of the Contaminated Sites Regulation?

values.label: Yes
No

components.html: If you answered NO to the question above, the form is not submitted to the ministry. As per Section 3.5 of the Contaminated Sites Regulation, a municipality or approving officer may still request a person to complete a site disclosure statement for their records.
components.label: Static Text

components.html: If you answered YES to the question above, you must complete this form if no exemptions apply.
components.label: Static Text
Do any of the exemptions from submitting a site disclosure statement apply? (see the CONTAMINATED SITES REGULATION, Division 3, Part 2)

values.label: Yes
No

components.html: If you answered NO to the question above, you must complete this form. All fields are mandatory unless otherwise noted.
components.label: Static Text

values.label: CSR section 4(1) - other processes apply under the Act
CSR section 4(2) - other processes apply under the Act
CSR section 4(3) - other processes apply under the Act
CSR section 4.1(1)(a) - persons applying to approving officers
CSR section 4.1(1)(b) - persons applying to approving officers

CSR section 4.2(2) - persons applying to municipalities
CSR section 4.3 - municipalities undertaking zoning or rezoning
CSR section 4.4 - more than one owner or operator required to provide site disclosure statement when ceasing operations on land
CSR section 4.5 - operating areas under the Oil and Gas Activities Act
CSR section 4.6 - vendors of real property
CSR section 4.7 - previous submission of site profile

components.title: Section III - SPECIFIED INDUSTRIAL OR COMMERCIAL USES

components.label: HTML
components.content: In the format of the examples provided below, select from the drop-down list, all the industrial or commercial uses described in SCHEDULE 2 which have occurred or are occurring on this site.

components.html:
Example Schedule 2 references and descriptions

E1. appliance, equipment, or engine maintenance, repair, reconditioning, cleaning or salvage

F10. solvent manufacturing, bulk storage, shipping and handling
components.label: Static Text

values.label: None
A1. adhesives manufacturing, bulk storage, shipping or handling
A2. chemical manufacturing, bulk storage, shipping or handling
A3. explosives or ammunition manufacturing, bulk storage, shipping or handling
A4. fire retardant manufacturing, bulk storage, shipping or handling
A5. fertilizer manufacturing, bulk storage, shipping or handling
A6. ink or dye manufacturing, bulk storage, shipping or handling
A7. leather or hides tanning
A8. paint, lacquer or varnish manufacturing, formulation, recycling, bulk storage, shipping or handling, not including retail stores
A9. pharmaceutical products, or controlled substances as defined in the Controlled Drugs and Substances Act (Canada), manufacturing or operations
A10. plastic products (foam or expanded plastic) manufacturing or repurposing
A11. textile dyeing
A12. pesticide manufacturing, formulation, bulk storage, shipping or handling
A13. resin or plastic monomer manufacturing, formulation, bulk storage, shipping or handling
B1. battery manufacturing, recycling, bulk storage, shipping or handling
B2. facilities using equipment that contains PCBs greater than or equal to 50 ppm
B3. electrical equipment manufacturing, refurbishing, bulk storage, shipping or handling
B4. electrical transmission or distribution substations
B5. electronic equipment manufacturing
B6. transformer oil manufacturing, processing, bulk storage, shipping or handling
B7. electrical power generating operations fuelled by coal or petroleum hydrocarbons that supply electricity to a community or commercial or industrial operation, excluding emergency generators
C1. foundries
C2. galvanizing
C3. metal plating or finishing
C4. metal salvage operations
C5. metal smelting or refining
C6. welding or machine shops (repair or fabrication)
D1. asbestos mining, milling, bulk storage, shipping or handling
D2. coal coke manufacture, bulk storage, shipping or handling
D3. coal or lignite mining, milling, bulk storage, shipping or handling
D4. milling reagent manufacture, bulk storage, shipping or handling
D5. metal concentrate bulk storage, shipping or handling
D6. metal ore mining or milling
E1. appliance, equipment or engine maintenance, repair, reconditioning, cleaning or salvage
E2. ash deposit from boilers, incinerators or other thermal facilities
E3. asphalt and asphalt tar manufacture, storage and distribution, including stationary asphalt batch plants
E4. coal gasification (manufactured gas production)
E5. medical, chemical, radiological or biological laboratories
E6. outdoor firearm shooting ranges
E7. road salt or brine storage
E8. measuring instruments (containing mercury) manufacture, repair or bulk storage
E9. dry cleaning facilities or operations and dry cleaning chemical storage, excluding locations at which clothing is deposited but no dry cleaning process occurs
E10. contamination or likely contamination of land by substances migrating from an industrial or commercial site
E11. fire training facilities at which fire retardants are used
E12. single or cumulative spills to the environment greater than the reportable quantities of substances listed in the Spill Reporting Regulation
F1. petroleum or natural gas drilling
F2. petroleum or natural gas production facilities
F3. natural gas processing
F4. petroleum coke manufacture, bulk storage, shipping or handling
F5. petroleum product, other than compressed gas, dispensing facilities, including service stations and card locks
F6. petroleum, natural gas or sulfur pipeline rights of way excluding rights of way for pipelines used to distribute natural gas to consumers in a community

F7. petroleum product (other than compressed gas), or produced water storage in non-mobile above ground or underground tanks, except tanks associated with emergency generators or with secondary containment
F8. petroleum product, other than compressed gas, bulk storage or distribution
F9. petroleum refining
F10. solvent manufacturing, bulk storage, shipping or handling
F11. sulfur handling, processing or bulk storage and distribution
G1. aircraft maintenance, cleaning or salvage
G2. automotive, truck, bus, subway or other motor vehicle maintenance, repair, salvage or wrecking
G3. dry docks, marinas, ship building or boat repair and maintenance, including paint removal from hulls
G4. marine equipment salvage
G5. rail car or locomotive maintenance, cleaning, salvage or related uses, including railyards
H1. antifreeze bulk storage, recycling, shipping or handling
H2. barrel, drum or tank reconditioning or salvage
H3. biomedical waste disposal
H4. bulk manure stockpiling and high rate land application or disposal (nonfarm applications only)
H5. landfilling of construction demolition material, including without limitation asphalt and concrete
H6. contaminated soil or sediment storage, treatment, deposit or disposal
H7. dry cleaning waste disposal
H8. electrical equipment recycling
H9. industrial waste lagoons or impoundments
H10. industrial waste storage, recycling or landfilling
H11. industrial woodwaste (log yard waste, hogfuel) disposal
H12. mine tailings waste disposal
H13. municipal waste storage, recycling, composting or landfilling
H14. organic or petroleum material landspreading (landfarming)
H15. sandblasting operations or sandblasting waste disposal
H16. septic tank pumpage storage or disposal
H17. sewage lagoons or impoundments
H18. hazardous waste storage, treatment or disposal
H19. sludge drying or composting
H20. municipal or provincial road snow removal dumping or yard snow removal dumping
H21. waste oil reprocessing, recycling or bulk storage
H22. wire reclaiming operations
I1. particle or wafer board manufacturing
I2. pulp mill operations
I3. pulp and paper manufacturing
I4. treated wood storage at the site of treatment
I5. veneer or plywood manufacturing
I6. wood treatment (antisapstain or preservation)
I7. wood treatment chemical manufacturing, bulk storage

components.label: Schedule 2 Reference and Description
components.description: Select "none" if no Schedule 2 uses apply

components.label: 1. Provide a brief summary of the planned activity and proposed land use at the site.
2. Indicate the information used to complete this site disclosure statement including a list of record searches completed.
3. List any past or present government orders, permits, approvals, certificates or notifications pertaining to the environmental condition of the site:

components.html: Where a municipal approval is not required, you must indicate the reason for submission directly to the registrar:
components.label: Static Text
Heading
components.content: By signing below, I confirm that the information in this form is complete and accurate to the best of my knowledge:

components.label: SIGNATURE
components.description: For agents completing the SDS, save to PDF then forward the form to the owner/operator to complete this section

values.label: Owner
Operator

components.html: All fields in this section must be completed by the municipality (including Regional Districts) or approving officer prior to forwarding the form to the Site Registrar.
